title: Migration of run metadata to tags
body:
This issue summarises an ongoing project to migrate run metadata from attributes to tags. @zblz, @mociarain and I have been working with @aarondav to implement these changes.

## Motivation

Currently, metadata about runs in MLflow is principally stored in attributes on the run model (or more precisely, as attributes of its 'RunInfo' object). For example, if you get a run from the `MlflowClient`:

```python
from mlflow.tracking.client import MlflowClient
run = MlflowClient().get_run('run-id')
```

its source name (e.g. the path of the script that was run) is accessed at:

```python
run.info.source_name
```

Adding additional run metadata in this model is onerous, as the following need to be changed any time a new field is added:

* The structure of the run model.
* The protobuf files (which are used for run serialisation in tracking stores).
* All implementations of tracking stores (three in the core library, but potentially more with #881).
* The `MlflowClient` API.
* The fluent tracking API.

It's therefore planned to migrate the following run attributes into tags:

* `run.info.name` as the tag `mlflow.runName`
* `run.info.source_type` as the tag `mlflow.source.type`
* `run.info.source_name` as the tag `mlflow.source.name`
* `run.info.entry_point_name` as the tag `mlflow.project.entryPoint`
* `run.info.user_id` as the tag `mlflow.username`

## Completed work

* #926 Store run metadata in tags as well as attributes.
* #930 Implement pluggable run context provider system.
* #974 [bugfix] Correct an error in how the source type was set as a tag.
* #1137 Restore parent_run_id argument to MlflowClient.create_run.

## In progress / in review

* #978 Remove run attributes from the arguments to `MlflowClient.create_run` that are expected to be passed as tags. `create_run` will instead read the removed arguments from tags and pass them to the store implementations for backwards compatibility.
* #981 Set run name and parent run ID tags in fluent layer instead of in tracking store implementations.

## Outstanding work

* Remove `user_id` argument from `MlflowClient.create_run` and set as tag in default context provider (after #981).
* Implement a Jupyter notebook `RunContextProvider`.
* Add deprecation warnings / notices to run metadata attributes to discourage use during the transition.
* Refactor tests of `mlflow.tracking.fluent` to avoid testing internal logic of `mlflow.tracking.context`
* Do some refactoring in `mlflow.tracking.context` to 'bake in' some of the helper methods to their respective context providers (dependent on the previous bullet).
* Update the R client to this logic (see discussion in #958). It probably makes sense to wait until the Python API is settled before doing this.
* Investigate if changes to the Java client are necessary.

## Later work (pre 1.0 release)

* UI and other clients to read run metadata from tags instead of attributes.
* Run metadata attributes to be removed.
